page.title: 10Leisure Activities Tongue
page.content: Indoor Bowls is an activity which takes place in the Village Hall dur ing the winter months. A Bowls Club was formed in 1982 and is open to all with a nominal membership fee and a payment of 50p per evening with play ing confined to one evening per week as a rule, with occasional matches against outside teams. The game is played on a special green carpet 9' wide running the full length of the main hall, and to National rules oper ating countrywide. The S.W.R.I.the Scottish Women's Rural Institute meet once a month and there are about 26 members. There are differ ent speakers at every meeting on a wide range of subjects. Meetings are open when the topic is of interest to the general public. The Rural meetings also enable members to socialize during the long winter days.
